result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher E. DeMarrias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: sentence now serving.
Concurrent with: 13CM384.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with Deana DeMarrias, unless agent approves.  In that case,   No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with Deana DeMarrias.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attend and successfully complete domestic violence programming, if agent recommends.

defendant.address: W8935 Elk Circle, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt:
2:46 PM Defendant Christopher E. DeMarrias in court.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court for Christopher E. DeMarrias.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim rights. Victim makes statement. Parties have revocation paperwork. State's has a couple of changes - 7/11 case #'s ending in correct #, charges as repeaters. Defense has not corrections. State recommended:  90 days on one case, 9 months on the other. 15CF87 - 1 yr jail on each count, concurrent to each other but consecutive to ?.  90 days jail credit in 13CM384, 93 days jail credit in 15CF87.       
Defense recommended:  6 months jail, concurrent. Agrees to State's days of credit.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution. 

Court ordered: 13CM384 - Count 2 - repeater 90 days jail as repeater, Count 3 - resisting 9 months concurrent to each other. 
15CF87 -  Count 5, disorderly - 90 days jail, Count 3 - resisting - 9 months jail, Count 4 - 9 months jail,  all 3 concurrent and concurrent to sentence in case 13CM384. Civil Judgment for unpaid costs and fees. 93 days credit on 15CF87. 90 days credit on 13CM384.  Jail does not have huber privileges Court does not approve EMP on the fact def has absconded although jail may override if so choses.
from Defendant's previous employer

Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.
SEHR rescheduled per request of Attorney Gardner due to a scheduling conflict. CLO

Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 17, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.
from Victim

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Judge Becker, he is no longer in DV Court as he is being revoked.
No show for DV Court.

DV Court - Has job interview next Monday.  He is to contact T.M. if he gets the job and any other details he finds out.  Court informed him to make arrangements around orientation with B.G. and T.M. both.  Discussed AODA.
for Domestic Violence Court Jail Sanction
DV court.  He is trying to set up assessment.  No employment yet.  He is looking.  Positive test.  Sanction 3 days.  Reschedule with B.G.  Set up community service, if no job.
DV Court.  First DV court hearing.  Expectations explained by the court.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Gardner.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  Victim present in 15CF87. Victim did not make a statement.   In 15CF87, defendant plead guilty Counts 3, 4 and 5 Counts 1 and 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  In 13CM384, plead guilty to Counts 2 and 3.  Count 1 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes. 13CT110 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Any tracking civil violations dismissed.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Repeater allegations confirmed.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty In 15CF87, of  Counts 3, 4 and 5.  Counts 1 and 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  In 13CM384, found guilty of Counts 2 and 3.  Count 1 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes. 13CT110 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for 3 years probation.    Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person,  with D.T., unless agent approves.  AODA, and recommended treatment.  DV programming, if agent recommends.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 years probation, each concurrent. Consecutive to sentence now serving.  Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person,  with D.D., unless agent approves.    No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with D.D.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA, and recommended treatment.  DV programming, if agent recommends.  Seek and maintain employment.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, DNA surcharge on 15CF87 only.

No appearance by defendant - he was transported from Stanley C.I.  He is at that facility until August.  Attorney Robert Gardner is present along with Gerald Fox for the State.  His cases will all be rescheduled for plea/sentencing on 4-11-16 at 10:00.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 15CF87 & 13CM384 - Initial appearance:  Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with counsel Robert Gardner present in courtroom.  Waives reading of complaints; waives time limits for prelim and requests pre-trial.  Judge reviews charges and potential penalties in 15CF87 with defendant.  He understands.  Questions defendant regarding waiver of time limits for prelim.  He wishes to waive.  Finds he knowingly and intelligently waives the time limits.  13CM284:  Reviews charges and potential penalties.  He understands and enters a not guilty plea.  13CT110, 13TR4085 are on for status.  Court sets pretrial on 7-08 and status on 7-27-15 at 3:45 in all cases.  Bond continued.
From attorney Gardner requesting adjournment to 6-15

Adjourned initial appearance at 06-08-2015 09:30 am
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, with Attorney Robert Gardner, specially.  Attorney Gardner expects to be retained this week.  AIA set for 6/8/15 at 9:30 am.
Initial appearance at 06-01-2015 09:30 am

Covers case No. 13CM384, 13CT110 and 15CF87.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no direct contact, with D.D.  May have contact by telephone or through a 3rd party.    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.  Provide the sheriff's dept.  of his address before release.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person from the jail and without counsel. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Defendant tried SPD, but he doesn't qualify.  He will talk to Attorney Robert Gardner about representation.  AIA set for 6/1/15 at 9:30 am.  Bond set.
